subject: Test implementation

messageBody:
If you define an interface, what is the best strategy to test all
implementing classes. Of course, you will create a specific test
class that will test every single detail in the implenting class. But
what about the methods declared in the interface, how can you be sure
that all implementing classes has implemented the interface
correctly?
I see two solution:
Extend the TestCase class, and name it TestAInterface and create test
methods for the interface. For every implementing class of A, extend
the TestAInterface instead of TestCase.

Create a Testcase class which you can pass the implementing class to
and create a TestSuite that will add a Test for all implementing
classes.

My opinion is that the first solution is better (at least sounds
better).
Is there a Best-practise for this problem?

Thanks in advance.
/Johan
